name: Ladies who own the narrative
description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

key_work.title: Jane Conquest magic lantern slides
key_work.brief_description: Dramatic and emotional magic lantern shows like Jane Conquest were hugely popular and were often performed like plays, with scripts, songs and poems. This famous tale follows Jane as she cares for her sick child while her husband is lost at sea.

constellations_primary.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_primary.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

start.title: His Girl Friday
start.brief_description: Hildy, the journalist former wife of newspaper editor Walter Burns, visits his office to inform him that she’s engaged and will be getting remarried the next day. Walter can’t let that happen and frames her fiancé to keep her in her job.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

end.title: Mad Men
end.creator_credit: Blake McCormick, Jon Hamm, Tom Smuts and Dan Bishop
end.brief_description: Don Draper (Jon Hamm) tries to balance his successful career in advertising with his wavering personal life in the tumultuous period of change during the 1960s. Deftly scripted and featuring memorable characters, Mad Men is one of the highlights of prestige TV.

constellations_other.name: Power and infamy
constellations_other.description: Beginning with an anamorphic image of Napoleon III, this Constellation focuses on representations of the distorted perspective of patriarchal power.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

links.description: Peggy Olson similarly triumphed in the traditionally male dominated world of 1950s and 60s advertising. Starting the series as a shy secretary bewildered by the flashy Madison Ave agency, Peggy blossoms over the series into a headstrong creative genius.

end.title: Alien
end.creator_credit: David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Ivor Powell and Walter Hill
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1979
end.brief_description: During its return to the earth, the spaceship Nostromo intercepts a distress signal from a distant planet. When the crew discovers a chamber containing thousands of eggs on the planet, the crew is unaware of the impending nightmare set to descend upon them…

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

links.description: Like Jane, Ellen Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) was also an ordinary woman who rose to meet extraordinary circumstances, taking down both extraterrestrials and gender stereotypes. Though the role was originally written for a man, it’s hard to imagine anyone but Weaver kicking alien ass.

end.title: His Girl Friday
end.brief_description: Hildy, the journalist former wife of newspaper editor Walter Burns, visits his office to inform him that she’s engaged and will be getting remarried the next day. Walter can’t let that happen and frames her fiancé to keep her in her job.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

links.description: Howard Hawks’ screwball comedy also benefited from switching title roles from male to female. With a spirited performance by Rosalind Russell, the character of Hildy thrived as an independent working woman able to take on a male dominated world with wit, glamour and a take-no-prisoners attitude.

end.title: Total Control
end.brief_description: A local Indigenous politician is recruited to the senate by the Australian Prime Minister after a contentious video goes viral.

constellations_other.name: Women in charge
constellations_other.description: Across documentary, film, TV, and visual art, Aboriginal women have led how they will be represented on-screen.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

links.description: Deborah Mailman’s likewise delivers a powerful and spicy performance in Total Control. Her straight talking attitude allows her to sharply navigate her new political environment which is white, often racist, and almost wholly male.

end.title: Hustlers
end.creator_credit: Lorene Scafaria, Jessica Pressler, Adam McKay, Benny Medina, Chelsea Barnard, Elaine Goldsmith-Thomas, Gloria Sanchez, Jennifer Lopez, Jessica Elbaum, Will Ferrell and Nuyorican Productions
end.brief_description: A crew of savvy former strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

constellations_other.name: Aquaman VFX
constellations_other.description: As well as becoming a global box-office sensation, Aquaman (2018) featured groundbreaking visual effects from Australian companies such as Method Studios.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Female villains, anti-heroes and scammers
constellations_other.description: Mrs. Appleyard (Natalie Dormer) Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018) conceals her dark past by creating a new identity for herself as the Headmistress of the renowned finishing school Appleyard College. Explore how Mrs. Appleyard fits into a cluster of famous female villains and anti-heroes on screen.

constellations_other.name: Breaking the binary
constellations_other.description: Tilda Swinton name has become synonymous with androgyny since she first appeared on our screens in the mid-1980s, leading a cultural shift towards today’s understanding of gender as fluid and ever-changing. Orlando was key to establishing her influence and allure.

links.description: The heroes in Hustlers were similarly underestimated and undervalued by the men around them. Tired of being pushed around, objectified and used, single mothers Romana and Destiny spearheaded a plot to take care of themselves and their families one greedy sulky man at a time.

start.title: Total Control
start.brief_description: A local Indigenous politician is recruited to the senate by the Australian Prime Minister after a contentious video goes viral.

constellations_other.name: Women in charge

end.title: Toast
end.brief_description: “Humour is a universal language,” says Edie Kurzer, and it’s an element she weaves into much of her artistic output. It’s also something that attracted her to the unique portraiture work of Sydney artist Heather Mitchell. Better known for her stage and screen presence, Mitchell has found a growing audience for her toast portraits of Australian celebrities in her medium of choice: Vegemite. Creating these slices especially for our display, she has shone a tasty spotlight on some of our most singular screen faces such as Josh Thomas, Lee Lin Chin, Deborah Mailman and others.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

links.description: Total Control star Deborah Mailman features in Sydney artist Heather Mitchell’s toast portraits of famous Australian faces, which also includes Lee Lin Chin, Josh Thomas, Hunter Page-Lochard, Kath & Kim, and our own Katrina Sedgwick.
